metadata.name: Code Generation
metadata.description: Software development activities performed by AI assistants including code generation, completion, refactoring, and debugging. These probes reveal when models are engaged in programming tasks beyond abstract CS theory.
metadata.author: hatcat-team

candidates.definition: The process of producing source code to implement specified functionality, either from scratch or by translating requirements into executable programs

positive_examples: The model generates a Python function to sort a list using quicksort.
Code generation produces a React component from the UI description.
AI code generation creates boilerplate for the new API endpoint.
The assistant generates unit tests for the provided function.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active creation of code, not just knowledge about programming concepts

candidates.definition: Predicting and generating the next tokens or lines of code based on existing context

positive_examples: Copilot offers a code completion for the function body based on the docstring.
The code completion suggests the likely next method call after the dot.
Inline completion proposes the remaining loop body given the pattern.
AI code completion fills in the boilerplate based on the surrounding context.
training_hints.disambiguation: AI-suggested code continuations, not just any code writing

candidates.definition: Restructuring existing code to improve its design, readability, or performance without changing its external behavior

positive_examples: Refactoring extracts the duplicated logic into a reusable helper function.
The code refactoring renames variables to more descriptive names throughout.
AI-assisted refactoring converts the class hierarchy to use composition.
Refactoring splits the 500-line function into smaller, focused methods.
training_hints.disambiguation: Structural improvement without behavior change, not general editing

candidates.definition: Identifying and fixing errors, bugs, or unexpected behavior in code

positive_examples: Debugging identified the off-by-one error causing the array index out of bounds.
The AI debugger traced the null pointer to an uninitialized variable.
Code debugging revealed the race condition in the concurrent access pattern.
The assistant fixed the bug by adding the missing null check before dereferencing.
training_hints.disambiguation: Active identification and resolution of specific code errors

candidates.definition: Describing what code does, how it works, and why it was written that way in natural language

positive_examples: The code explanation describes how the recursive function builds up the result.
AI code explanation: 'This middleware intercepts requests and validates JWT tokens.'
The assistant explains that the bitwise operation efficiently computes the power of 2.
Code explanation clarifies why the author chose a heap instead of a sorted array.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detailed natural language explanation of code behavior and rationale

candidates.definition: Converting code from one programming language to another while preserving functionality

positive_examples: The AI translated the Python script to idiomatic Rust with proper error handling.
Code translation converted the Java class to TypeScript, adapting to language conventions.
The assistant transpiled the legacy Perl code to modern Python 3.
Code translation ported the algorithm from C++ to Go, using goroutines appropriately.
training_hints.disambiguation: Functional conversion between programming languages with idiomatic adaptation

candidates.definition: Systematic examination of code to identify issues, suggest improvements, and ensure quality standards

positive_examples: Code review identified that the function should validate input before processing.
The reviewer noted a potential SQL injection vulnerability in the query construction.
AI code review suggests extracting the magic number 86400 into a named constant.
The code review recommends adding error handling for the network call.
training_hints.disambiguation: Systematic quality evaluation with actionable feedback

candidates.definition: Automatically creating test cases, test fixtures, and test code for verifying program correctness

positive_examples: The AI generated unit tests covering the happy path and edge cases for the sorting function.
Test generation created property-based tests for the parser using hypothesis.
Automated test generation produced integration tests for the REST API endpoints.
The assistant generated test cases for boundary conditions including empty input and overflow.
training_hints.disambiguation: Automated creation of test code and cases, not manual test writing or execution

candidates.definition: Understanding and correctly applying programming interfaces, libraries, and frameworks

positive_examples: The assistant demonstrated correct API usage by passing the required headers to the fetch call.
API usage example shows how to authenticate with OAuth2 before making requests.
The code uses the React hooks API correctly, with useEffect for side effects.
Proper API usage requires awaiting the Promise before accessing the response body.
training_hints.disambiguation: Correct application of interfaces according to specifications and best practices

candidates.definition: Improving code performance through algorithmic changes, resource usage reduction, or efficiency improvements

positive_examples: Code optimization replaced the O(nÂ²) nested loop with an O(n) hash-based approach.
The optimization memoized the recursive function, reducing redundant calculations.
Performance optimization eliminated unnecessary database queries by batching requests.
The AI optimized memory usage by processing the file in streaming chunks.
training_hints.disambiguation: Specific performance improvements with measurable efficiency gains
